text: I want to find a job. I wasn't really strong in biology or related classes. But I had to take a scientific way, because I think that's the best choice today, according to the work's market, in order to find a job and earning enough money to live the life that I want to live. I was pretty good at mathematics so I took engineering studies and I enjoyed binary during a class during high school. I liked programming, making computer science linked to Lego Mindstorms, learning some stuff about networks. No one really inspired me, I've just been hearding of people who were for example in Paris, working on the web site of a clothes store. What inspired me was the freedom of the profession. Informatics and algorithms are everywhere : from your very simple washing machine to a complex robot on Mars. So I understood that the all world will always need informatics. I'd like to work abroad and I think I could easily find some jobs in another country. More over, it's really wide. In the next 10 years for sure, the world will need informatics technicians, plenty of jobs are just waiting for them, but at the same time, those software technicians are missing, and the most you're not ordinary (at least in what job recruiters are looking for), the most you're precious (and eventually well payed). You do not have to be the best, because the competition is not as strong as it could be in other fields and people are less fighting against each other because more jobs are available.
